page.title: 14LOCAL VILLAGES.
page.content: { EDDLETHORPE}village was once much larger.Apart from post-war houses and Georgian{Eddlethorpe Grange}only Manor Farm,the ruin of the mills and the old hunt kennels,where pedigree hackney horses were bred,still remain. { LOW HUTTON}village has various types of buildings, dating from the 1850's to the present day ,although it's history goes much further back.In the 12th.Century there was a timber hall and Manor,whose earthworks can still be seen.The 13th.Century chapel was pulled down in 1800.The village school (1856) is now a private house. A suspension bridge links{MENETHORPE and{Low Hutton}over the river Derwent. It is an ancient crossing place and a ferry was still working in 1840.The village is to the east of the bridge and{Menethorpe Hall}stands in parkland now used as dairy pasture.
